content:
As usual, Grandma wanted a video call with me. I haven’t seen Grandma for a while, so I just sat there and staring. Grandma tried so hard asking me to “stand up”, “walk around”, “say something”…etc. and that’s when Dad blew up, he accused Grandma always being manipulative and trying to control his life. Dad was furious, he threw a lot of f* words around, blamed Grandma for a lot of things that I didn’t know. I think deep down Dad had lots of thoughts never shared with anyone and he doesn’t want to put up with Grandma anymore. On top of that, I heard Dad’s been having rough nights at work, often not getting to bed until 3 AM, so exhaustion maybe another factor causing him lose control.
I have never seen Dad so angry, I think he needs anger management or at least watch that movie again. This time it wasn’t directed at me though, I was just a bystander. I think there is a long history between Dad and grandma and I heard it all today. I think Dad had buried all of his thoughts and tolerated grandma for so long until today that he finally exploded. I am not sure if Mom had anything to do with this, but it was scary to see Dad like this, he screamed and seemed totally lost control of himself during the arguments and it ended with Grandma hang up the phone. I will probably never hear from Grandma again, though I thought she was a nice lady.
The history between Dad and Grandma is a long one. Dad accused Grandma’s strong desire to try influence and control everyone around her. I do recall that Grandma would always tell Dad what she wants him to do, such as how to raise a baby, send me to learn piano, or wanting me to pick up ballerina, or learn how to swim…etc. She also constantly sends Dad these videos showing off other kid’s performing music. I don’t blame Dad. I am just a toddler and started learning how the world works around me and I got enough to learn already !
The other factor comes from Grandma’s nagging of asking Dad to get another baby. After what Mom’s been through and because of her age, I understand why they don’t want another baby, not that I can help, or is making things any better. But I think this is my Dad and Mom’s own decision to make. Not to mention that Grandma never helped taking care of me. I think she’s selfish wanting to fulfill her own desire.
Lastly, Grandma’s Republican political view is no help here either. I think maybe that’s what fundamentally shaped Grandma’s idealogy and all of these naggings. Grandma and step Grandpa love Donald Trump and they love themselves too. They think Trump will save the world, defeat the evil, and there is all corruptions in Democrats. Well, who’s the naive one now ? Dad always try to remind them to look at things from both sides, but they never listened, and eventually Dad and Grandma had to mutually agree to never bring up politics in their conversations. Dad thinks they are a “hopeless pair”, his words, not mine.
Alfred Adler suggested that all of our annoyance, troubles and depressions in life stem from relationships with others. The closer you are with someone, the more depression you can be and the more mood swings. I think he is right, maybe at one point Dad tried so hard to satisfy what Grandma wanted and forgot about himself. He’s an adult and should have his own will and should simply walk away from such complicated relationships. Alfred Adler also suggests never to blame today’s suffering on the past. Grandma does this a lot, she will blame how Chinese cultural revolution ruined her life, she blamed Great Grandma never gave her enough educations and that herself suffered and sacrificed a lot to get to where she is today. Nothing wrong with that, but living in the past is to live in the shadow.
There is no way to change the past, we can only change today, and future is just a combinations of moments that will occur because of decisions we are making today.
Living in other’s expectations and wanting others to behave the way you want them to be is also futile. In short, Alfred Adler’s idea is simply as simple as “mind your f* business”. How others judge your behavior, is other’s problem, not yours, and never try to behave in a way to avoid other’s judgement. Everyone judges differenlty and you can’t satisfy everyone.

Dad was furious, he threw a lot of f* words around, blamed Grandma for a lot of things that I didn’t know.

content:
Well, this was an awkward day. I didn’t think this small incident would worth its own journal page, but why not.
Just as usual, Dad would give me a bath and leave me alone to play with water for 30 minutes. However, I was having such an amazing time and forgot how long it’s been. It must have been hours sitting in that bath tub and still not felt bored.
Just as I was having a blast, Dad decided to drain the water and let me sitting in an empty tub on the floor !! Fine, I couldn’t take it and decided it was time to get out, but somehow I needed to use the bathroom (#2 btw) just as I was standing up. Boy that felt good, but when I saw my own poop, I can’t help but screamed and started crying. Frankly, I don’t think I’ve really seen my own poop before and it was quite a scene !! I couldn’t believe my eyes and seeing that kind of stuff coming out of my bottom is unspeakable !!
Well, I didn’t think I was gonna have such a big reaction. Now I feel bad for Dad and Mom for taking care me everyday and doing these unspeakable things! No, not really feeling bad at all, that was just a joke.

I don’t know how many times you guys have have ruined my world, I’ve lost count, but here they are anyways, because even if you don’t remember them, I do !
18 Months Memories Remember those times when I wanted to stay in bath for just two more hours so I can play with my watering can ? For unknown reasons, you just had to drag me out of it, and you keep doing it every day no matter how hard I cried each time !! Ridiculous !!
Mom, remember that time when you bought a Lego car for Declan ? (BTW, he’s not my boyfriend, at least not yet !). I can’t believe that you won’t let me have it. You broke my heart. Fortunately they healed 2 minutes later when I saw a box of nails, then you decided to break my heart again by refusing me. Life was already hard enough !!
Dad, demember that time when we are about to go home after groceries shopping and you insisted on putting me back in the car seat? Why can’t you just let me wander around in the parking lot ? My life was totally ruined after that !!

content:
Dad and Mom had a quarrel today. I think it started when Mom accused Dad for working too much, even on weekends, and Dad denied it, as usual, of course. I suppose not everything that Dad does on his computer is considered working, but that’s how Mom perceived it anyways.
So for 3 days, Dad had a really long face, pretending there is nothing wrong. When Mom asked “Are you OK?”, it always “Yeah, I am fine”.
I honestly don’t understand what the big deal is. Just cry if you are unhappy, laugh if you are happy. Simple as that!
Life is made up of each individual moment, every unhappy moment takes away from the happy ones. After all, I just need you two to make me happy, as the saying goes, happy Baby, happy life, right ?

content:
Today is valentine! Whatever that means. Well, as usual, another date with Declan it is, and to my surprise, my little “boyfriend” Declan brought me gifts today, is it because of Valentine ? If so, I would like a daily Valentine!
Declan gifted me a small red teddy bear and a book of friendships. Maybe he just wants to be friends more than “boyfriend”, I am OK with that too.
Later that day, I had dinner with Mom and Dad at Scratch Kitchen & Taproom. We’ve been there before. However, this time, Mom decided to let me have some curry spice noodles (by accident, allegedly) and boy it was spicy !! I cried and cried, I also refused having any water. Eventually the burning went away, and I will forever remember that day as the “Burning Valentine’s”!

content:
There were too many “firsts”, I can’t remember them all, some are fuzzy and some are clear. Either way, I can’t verify them, so writing them down is the only way to make sure that I don’t lie to whomever is going to interview me when I become famous.
Important Firsts My first words were “Dada”. (Sure Dad, whatever) Mom taught me to learn how to roll and sit. My first walk happened in Dad’s home office (no, he wasn’t working, I dare him miss my first baby step) My first kiss was given (or be given, if you know what I mean) to my Dad. My first picture was taken in the hospital, you know, taken by these alledgely professional photographers that charges you $200 for a few pictures. My first road trip was to the Atlantic Beach, and it was aweful ! (Yes, aweful, NOT awesome) My first full sentenc - 妈妈，去洗澡(Mama, go take a shower) My first pediatrician visit was pretty aweful, I thought the nurse was being nice to me, but instead she stuck something into my thigh !! What a pain in the thigh she is ! Non-Imporant Firsts My first book was a collection of “First xyz book for babies” My first toy was this baby toy that you hang above crib, and it played Chinese songs, that’s how I knew it was made in China. My first real baby gift was from Eric, he is a good friend of Dad’s

content:
I honestly think that Dad and Mom were more excited than I am going to the beach. We booked a small room from Airbnb with 1 bedroom and a small kitchen. Somehow I ended up sleeping on the floor, yes, on the floor !! Can you imagine being a baby, sleeping on the cold and hard floor all alone ? It’s ridiculous ! So I decided to cry all night, which is how I always get my way and it worked! Mom and Dad finally agreed to put me in bed with them, and I slept really well for all those nights, though not so much for them. But who cares, the trip was to make me happy anyways
The location of the Airbnb room was fantastic. It was just a few walks away from the beach, weather was OK, I think only 1 day was sunny enough to stay by the beach, the other days were either too windy or too raining. Either way, I didn’t care, because it turns out that I don’t like the beach ! I am not a fan of sand, I just don’t like the tingling feelings and I refuse to put my feet on the beach or I start crying immediately !!
I heard and saw Mom trying to learn swimming; Dad was such a patient teacher, I adore him. They wanted me to learn swimming as well, and it was my first time putting a swim suit. The first day was fine, and watching Mom learning swimming isn’t as bad, after all she’s just as good as me. But 1 day is all I can stand, I refuse watching her learning every day, it’s just a very boring thing to do at the beach !!
The last day was great ! We had dinner at Amos Mosquito’s, they had amazing seafood, I enjoyed it there though I forgot what I had, but it was great for sure because I overheard Dad that the total was $100, so it must be good food !

content:
This is just a brief introduction to my family. Where I came from, who my mom is, and why I am here
Birth I was born at 1:43 AM on 6/7/2023, weighted 7 pounds and 7 oz after my Mom strugged for 24 hours, allegedly anyways. Technically speaking, I am 20 months now, but I like to sound younger, I mean, who doesn’t these days?
At birth, it was supposed to be all sunny and shiny, you know, seeing the lights for the first time and all, but quite the contrary, it was all too dark. Well, again, allegedly, it was because my bilirubin level was too high, whatever that means, so I had to undergo treatment under UV for several days with my eyes covered in total dark.
There goes several days of no sunlight and I had no idea what was happening outsdie, not that I cared anyways. At least I think Dad and Mom were quite worried.
Mother My mom was a teacher, but now she’s my full-time personal assistant, without pay. The story I heard was that mom gave up everything she had in China and decided to move to the US with my Dad. Mom’s family disagreed with the relationship and mom fought back fiercely, and maintained the long distance relationship for years. Eventually, they got married, bought a house, and had me - the American dream come true I guess ?
Father Dad is some sort of “network engineer”, I guess it must be difficult to connect with people these days that they need an engineer to help networking each other.
I was born networking with two people already, it can’t be that hard, can it ?
Dad always talk to this little screen in front of him, or staring at it for hours, sometimes making noises hitting the board beneth. I don’t think Dad always likes to talking to the screen though, he definitely frown a lot when the word “aidn” is mentioned.
Juno The Name It’s rumored that because Mom watched some video (YouTube actually) of this british/korean kid whoes name is also “Juno” and apparently she matches the image of what my mom saw in me. Oh, and of course, I was born in June, which probably contributed to <1% to the final decision. Oh well, but I won’t become what she imagined, I be me, no one else and that is Juno’s promise !
The Diary I figured it’s about time that I do something to channel my thoughts into words before I turn 18. You never know someday I might become famous and this would be how I tell folks about my childhood. Or maybe, just maybe, I needed this personal space for things that I can’t tell neither Dad nor Mom.
